Rule.NonCompliantComment: Non-administrative users have full database access, which may allow unauthorized actions.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Restrict full database access to administrative users only (e.g., root, DBA).
Rule.Correction: mysql -u root -p -e "REVOKE ALL PRIVILEGES, GRANT OPTION FROM 'user'@'%';"
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SELECT user,host,grant_priv FROM mysql.user WHERE grant_priv='Y';" | grep -v 'root' && echo 1 || echo 0

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'FILE' privilege is granted to non-administrative users, which may allow unauthorized file access.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the 'FILE' privilege is restricted to administrative users only.
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SELECT user,host FROM mysql.user WHERE File_priv='Y';" | grep -v 'root' && echo 1 || echo 0

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'PROCESS' privilege is granted to non-administrative users, exposing process information.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the 'PROCESS' privilege is restricted to administrative users only.
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SELECT user,host FROM mysql.user WHERE Process_priv='Y';" | grep -v 'root' && echo 1 || echo 0

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'SUPER' privilege is granted to non-administrative users, increasing security risks.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the 'SUPER' privilege is restricted to administrative users only.
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SELECT user,host FROM mysql.user WHERE Super_priv='Y';" | grep -v 'root' && echo 1 || echo 0

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'SHUTDOWN' privilege is granted to non-administrative users, which may allow unauthorized server shutdowns.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the 'SHUTDOWN' privilege is restricted to administrative users only.
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SELECT user,host FROM mysql.user WHERE Shutdown_priv='Y';" | grep -v 'root' && echo 1 || echo 0

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'CREATE USER' privilege is granted to non-administrative users, increasing security risks.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the 'CREATE USER' privilege is restricted to administrative users only.
Rule.Correction: mysql -u root -p -e "REVOKE CREATE USER ON *.* FROM 'user'@'%';"
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SELECT user,host FROM mysql.user WHERE Create_user_priv='Y';" | grep -v 'root' && echo 1 || echo 0

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'GRANT OPTION' is granted to non-administrative users, allowing them to grant privileges.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the 'GRANT OPTION' is restricted to administrative users only.
Rule.Correction: mysql -u root -p -e "REVOKE GRANT OPTION ON *.* FROM 'user'@'%';"
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SELECT user,host FROM mysql.user WHERE Grant_priv='Y';" | grep -v 'root' && echo 1 || echo 0

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'REPLICATION SLAVE' privilege is granted to non-administrative users.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the 'REPLICATION SLAVE' privilege is restricted to administrative users only.
Rule.Correction: mysql -u root -p -e "REVOKE REPLICATION SLAVE ON *.* FROM 'user'@'%';"
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SELECT user,host FROM mysql.user WHERE Repl_slave_priv='Y';" | grep -v 'root' && echo 1 || echo 0

Rule.NonCompliantComment: DML/DDL privileges are granted broadly, increasing security risks.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Limit DML/DDL privileges to specific databases and users.
Rule.Correction: mysql -u root -p -e "REVOKE ALL PRIVILEGES ON *.* FROM 'user'@'%';"
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW GRANTS FOR 'user'@'%';" | grep -q 'GRANT USAGE' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Stored procedures and functions are defined without secure DEFINER/INVOKER settings.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Securely define stored procedures and functions using 'DEFINER' and 'INVOKER'.
Rule.Correction: mysql -u root -p -e "ALTER PROCEDURE proc_name SQL SECURITY INVOKER;"
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW CREATE PROCEDURE proc_name;" | grep -q 'SQL SECURITY INVOKER' && echo 0 || echo 1
